snippet: A Gallup poll of all 50 states found that Rhode Island was least appreciated by its own residents. Some residents think the economy and a history of corruption are still hindrances.
abstract: Gallup poll of all 50 states finds that Rhode Island is least appreciated by its own residents, with only 18 percent saying it is best place or one of best places to live; some residents think the state's struggling economy and a history of corruption are still hindrances.
lead_paragraph: A Gallup poll of all 50 states found that Rhode Island was least appreciated by its own residents. Some residents think the economy and a history of corruption are still hindrances.

headline.main: Rhode Island, a State Sized Just Right to Contain Its Pride
headline.print_headline: A State Sized Just Right to Contain Its Pride
